result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Glynnell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to defendant's employment or residence.
Consecutive to: to any sentence defendant is serving.

Court costs and payment plan fee shall be paid at a rate of $50 per month commencing 12-01-2022 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full or judgment.  
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: District Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob L. Glynnell in custody via video and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Resolution reached.  State is in compliance with victim rights.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2.  No contest plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Per request of Atty. Edgar Beltran, 8-17-2022 Hearing rescheduled to 9-07-2022 at 1:15 p.m.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob L. Glynnell in court in custody and without counsel.  Defendant has not heard from State Public Defender.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Not possess any dangerous weapons. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with S.J.G. or her residence. Defendant allowed one 20 minute visit to the residence while law enforcement is present to obtain personal belongings.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob L Glynnell appeared by video, in custody. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  SPD slip provided to defendant; Court sets $300 cash bond.  Statements from defendant.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on July 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
